block.p: Dana Forester Cornell, a daughter of Sharon Salembier Lawson of Armonk, N.Y., and the late John R. Cornell, was married last evening to Robert James MacNaughton III, a son of Dr. and Mrs. MacNaughton Jr. of Greenville, S.C. The Rev. Ronald E. Gonia performed the ceremony at the University United Methodist Church in Chapel Hill, N.C., with the Rev. James Devereux, a Roman Catholic priest, taking part.
The bride and the bridegroom graduated from Washington and Lee University, where they met.

Dana Forester Cornell, a daughter of Sharon Salembier Lawson of Armonk, N.Y., and the late John R. Cornell, was married last evening to Robert James MacNaughton III, a son of Dr. and Mrs. MacNaughton Jr. of Greenville, S.C. The Rev. Ronald E. Gonia performed the ceremony at the University United Methodist Church in Chapel Hill, N.C., with the Rev. James Devereux, a Roman Catholic priest, taking part.
The bride and the bridegroom graduated from Washington and Lee University, where they met.

Mrs. MacNaughton, 26, was until June a senior account executive in the Raleigh, N.C., office of Brodeur Worldwide, a public relations firm. Her father was a partner in Whitman & Ransom, a New York law firm. She is also a stepdaughter of Henry C. Lawson.

Mr. MacNaughton, 28, received an M.B.A. in May from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. Next month he is to become an associate in the high-yield bond department of Credit Suisse First Boston, the New York investment bank. His father, a general surgeon, has a private practice in Greenville.
